# The `LockFileManager` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Class that manages the creation of a lock file to aid implicit coordination between different processes. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<CodeBlock>class llvm::LockFileManager</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Class that manages the creation of a lock file to aid implicit coordination between different processes.

The implicit coordination works by creating a &quot;.lock&quot; file alongside the file that we&#39;re coordinating for, using the atomicity of the file system to ensure that only a single process can create that &quot;.lock&quot; file. When the lock file is removed, the owning process has finished the operation.

Definition at line 27 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/lockfilemanager-h">LockFileManager.h</a>.

The lock file has been created and is owned by this instance of the object
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a1fcefc1a8c747197b9ee8b5e99d732fcabfd64c399ca341b115a17cf25bf161a2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="LFS_Shared">
The lock file already exists and is owned by some other instance

<EnumerationListItem name="LFS_Error">
An error occurred while trying to create or find the lock file

### unsafeRemoveLockFile() {#a69275e764ccafbee027de7780fa72e4a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code LockFileManager::unsafeRemoveLockFile ()</>}>
Remove the lock file.

This may delete a different lock file than the one previously read if there is a race.

### waitForUnlock() {#a8a975a4bfeea746f3269211bd72a02e2}

<MemberDefinition
